page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: This is the sole economic activity within the area. Because of the cool,wet climate there are no crops other than grass and the periodical sowing of swedes and rape mixed with grass as winter fodder for stock as part of the reseeding cycle. The principal use to which the land is put is for rearing sheep for the fat lamb market. There are some cattle, too, but the area devoted to them is small compared with sheep. Any specialisation in cattle is for beef animals. There is virtually no milk production within the area. Most of the farms adjoining Fforest Fach have grazing rights upon the hill.This is shared between a large number of sheep and a few small herds of mountain ponies. A few ponies are sold each autumn and these usually end up as pet food.
